intro: [WRONG START] Pulla glabra var. verticillata, commonly known as the smooth pullea, is a perennial herb native to certain regions of southern Africa. It features a basal rosette of broad, smooth, and waxy leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and early summer. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique foliage and flowering pattern make it an interesting subject for botanical study and ornamental gardening.
